abstract: Wealth Matters column; home improvement costs may not add enough value to home to offset initial outlay, and in some instances reduce home's value; adding value to house depends on type of renovation and particular housing market; new roofs and insulation have high financial return.
lead_paragraph: Even when updates increase a home’s price, the increase may not line up with the costs of the changes. Certain changes may even lower a home’s value.

headline.main: Renovations That Add Value to a Home: Think Shingles, Not Marble
headline.print_headline: Renovations That Add Value to a Home: Think Shingles, Not Marble

snippet: Even when updates increase a home’s price, the increase may not line up with the costs of the changes. Certain changes may even lower a home’s value.
